issues.description: The problem statement (UML and textual tasks) specifies Animal.messageOnFeed() as returning String, and the examples in the song/printing expect a String return value. The solution repository instead declares Animal.messageOnFeed() to return FeedResponse (a custom type) and implementations for Pig and Seal return FeedResponse. This is a cross-artifact return-type mismatch: students reading the problem will implement messageOnFeed() to return String, but the solution uses a different return type, which is structurally inconsistent and will confuse students about the required signature.
issues.suggested_fix: Align the return type across artifacts. Either (A) change the solution to match the problem statement by making Animal.messageOnFeed() return String and update Pig/Seal implementations to return the specified String messages (remove or stop using FeedResponse), or (B) update the problem statement and template to document and require a FeedResponse return type (including adjusting examples and wording). Option A is recommended to match the UML and textual description (messageOnFeed(): String).

issues.description: Within the solution repository there is an internal inconsistency: Animal.messageOnFeed() is declared to return FeedResponse, but Goat.messageOnFeed() in the solution returns String. This mismatch causes a compile-time override/signature conflict (Goat does not correctly implement the abstract method), so the provided solution as-is is structurally invalid and will not compile or serve as a correct reference for students.
issues.suggested_fix: Fix the solution repository so all implementations and the abstract declaration use the same return type. Concretely, either change Goat.messageOnFeed() to return FeedResponse (and construct an appropriate FeedResponse) or — preferably to match the problem statement — change Animal.messageOnFeed() to return String and update Pig and Seal to return String as well, removing FeedResponse usage.

issues.description: The problem statement (UML and textual description) and the template expect the abstract method messageOnFeed() to return a String (see Animal { messageOnFeed():String } and the sing/feed methods that print the returned value). The solution repository changes the method signature to return a FeedResponse object (Animal.messageOnFeed(): FeedResponse) and adds a FeedResponse class. This creates a mismatch: students implementing messageOnFeed() as specified in the problem/template (returning String) will have an API mismatch with the provided solution; conversely, the solution mixes return types (e.g. Goat.messageOnFeed() returns String while Animal declares FeedResponse), which is internally inconsistent. This discrepancy causes confusion about the expected type and how to print/feed animals and adds unnecessary cognitive load.
issues.suggested_fix:
Unify the messageOnFeed() API across all artifacts. Recommended options:
1) Restore the original specification: change Animal.messageOnFeed() in the solution to return String and update Seal and Pig to return the feed message Strings (remove FeedResponse class). This aligns solution, template, and problem statement and keeps printing simple.
OR
2) If FeedResponse is intentionally required, update the problem statement and template to document that messageOnFeed() returns a FeedResponse (describe its semantics) and make all concrete Animal implementations consistently return FeedResponse (replace any String-returning implementations like Goat). Ensure Farm prints response.getMessage() or relies on FeedResponse.toString() as documented.
